text: (Chopping and cheery music)
Hi everybody!

Do you like asparagus? I make delicious 
side dishes with this all the time .
Korean style: sweet, sour, and spicy.
This is one bunch, one pound.

I like to choose asparagus with 
thin and long stems.

Really pretty. After all cleanup, it's 
going to be 10 or 11 oz.
Around 350g.
My rice is really bubbling now!
And then I will add frozen peas.
And turn down the heat to low.

This part is the tough part.
Just hold this...
at the end, like this.

Naturally snapped.
Like this.
(snapping)
Or you can just cut off.
Cut off about 1 and a half inches.
You see? Very fresh.
So we are going to use these.
And don't throw away these hard stems.
Just add these when you made vegetable stock
they have a lot of flavor.
So, let's blanch!

These stems are so thin, you can 
 blanch them only one minute.

So it's already 1 minute.
I will turn off the heat.
Let's rinse in cold water.
(running water)
These guys are so tender and beautiful.

Then let's make seasoning.
2 garlic cloves.
And one green onion

(laughs)

because they are frozen. (laughs)

Scorched rice, that's my favorite.
Ok!

Let's make seasoning sauce!
With this garlic and green onion.
And soy sauce 1 tablespoon.
This is apple cider vinegar 2 tbs.
Very delicious.

Hot pepper paste, gochujang, 
around 2 tablespoons.

Sesame oil, 2 teaspoons.
One, two.

And toasted sesame seeds.

Around 1 tablespoon.

So pretty, isn't it?
Sprinkle more sesame seeds.

And this is today's recipe, 
asparagus side dish.
This is my usual meal, Korean meal.
Ok, rice. Rice is the main thing!
So let's have this.

This. If this is too long for you,
then cut it.

Cut off and then mix this, it's up to you.
But I like to enjoy the whole thing.
Mmm!

Mmm!
These are banchan, all side dishes.

This asparagus is really tender.
Tender and crispy.
And with seasoning sauce it's amazing.
Today we made an asparagus side dish.
Enjoy my recipe, see you next time!
Bye!!
